title: Write integration tests for environment persistence
description:
Create integration tests to verify environment persistence across scenarios.

Files: test/integration/environment-persistence.test.ts (NEW)

Test Scenarios:

1. Environment survives shell exit:
   - Create session with profile env
   - Exit shell (send 'exit' command)
   - Reconnect to session
   - Verify environment variables still present

2. Agent restart preserves environment:
   - Create agent session with API keys
   - Send agent exit (or crash it)
   - Restart agent via restart_agent handler
   - Verify API keys still in environment

3. Profile isolation works without breaking HOME:
   - Create session with profile
   - Verify user's .bashrc loaded (echo $BASH_VERSION)
   - Verify CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR points to profile
   - Verify HOME still points to real home

4. Runtime port conflicts detected:
   - Start a server on port 3000
   - Create session with PORT=3000
   - Verify runtime conflict warning returned

5. Environment stack merges correctly:
   - Create folder env with VAR1=folder
   - Create profile with VAR1=profile, VAR2=profile
   - Verify VAR1=folder (folder wins), VAR2=profile

Test Infrastructure:
- Use real tmux sessions (not mocked)
- Create/cleanup sessions in beforeEach/afterEach
- Use test-specific session names (rdv-test-*)

Tests: This IS the test task, should pass when done
close_reason: Created comprehensive integration tests in src/integration/environment-persistence.test.ts covering: (1) tmux session-level env persistence, (2) TmuxEnvironment merge with precedence, (3) ProfileIsolation XDG paths without HOME override, (4) runtime port conflict detection with real TCP servers, (5) environment stack merging. All 18 tests pass.

title: Create agent_profile and agent_config database tables
description:
Add new database tables for agent profile management:

CREATE TABLE agent_profile (
  id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES user(id),
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  icon TEXT,
  color TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE agent_config (
  id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  profile_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES agent_profile(id),
  agent_type TEXT NOT NULL,  -- claude, gemini, opencode, codex
  config_json TEXT NOT NULL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP,
  UNIQUE(profile_id, agent_type)
);
close_reason: All Phase 1 tasks completed: UI fixes, database schema, service layer, shared components, and API routes

title: Update TmuxService to use set-environment instead of send-keys
description:
Refactor TmuxService to use tmux set-environment for persistent environment.

File: src/services/tmux-service.ts

Changes:
1. Add setSessionEnvironment() function (lines ~335):
   - Use 'tmux set-environment -t session KEY value'
   - Iterate over all variables
   - Handle errors gracefully

2. Add getSessionEnvironment() function (lines ~365):
   - Use 'tmux show-environment -t session'
   - Parse output into Record<string, string>

3. Modify createSession() function (lines 78-159):
   - REMOVE shellEnv parameter from function signature
   - REMOVE shell export logic (lines 136-145)
   - Keep env parameter for process environment (PTY spawn)
   - Document that session environment is set separately

4. Update function documentation to explain the two-layer approach:
   - PTY env: passed to node-pty spawn
   - Session env: set via setSessionEnvironment() after creation

Note: Callers (SessionService) will need to call setSessionEnvironment() 
after createSession() - this is intentional separation.

Tests: Verify environment persists across shell exits
close_reason: Removed shellEnv parameter, session-service now uses setSessionEnvironment() for persistent env vars

title: Create TmuxEnvironment value object
description:
Create an immutable value object for tmux environment variables.

File: src/domain/value-objects/TmuxEnvironment.ts

Responsibilities:
- Represent environment variables as immutable Map
- Validate environment variable keys (^[A-Z][A-Z0-9_]*$)
- Validate environment variable values (escape dangerous chars)
- Provide merge() method with precedence control
- Provide toRecord() for conversion to plain object

Interface:
- static create(vars: Record<string, string>): TmuxEnvironment
- static empty(): TmuxEnvironment
- merge(other: TmuxEnvironment, precedence: 'this' | 'other'): TmuxEnvironment
- get(key: string): string | undefined
- has(key: string): boolean
- toRecord(): Record<string, string>
- entries(): IterableIterator<[string, string]>

title: Create ProfileIsolation value object
description:
Create a value object for XDG-compliant profile isolation WITHOUT overriding HOME.

File: src/domain/value-objects/ProfileIsolation.ts

Responsibilities:
- Generate XDG environment variables for profile isolation
- Preserve user's real HOME (don't override)
- Generate agent-specific config paths (CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR, CODEX_HOME, etc.)
- Generate GIT_CONFIG_GLOBAL path
- Validate SSH key paths for GIT_SSH_COMMAND

Interface:
- static create(profileDir: string, realHome: string): ProfileIsolation
- toEnvironment(): TmuxEnvironment
- getConfigHome(): string
- getDataHome(): string  
- getCacheHome(): string
- getGitConfigPath(): string

The key insight: Use XDG_CONFIG_HOME, XDG_DATA_HOME, XDG_CACHE_HOME instead of HOME override. This lets agents use isolated configs while user's dotfiles (.bashrc, .zshrc) still load from real HOME.

Tests: Verify XDG paths generated correctly, HOME not included in output
close_reason: Implemented ProfileIsolation and PortConflictError with full test coverage

title: Create RestartAgentUseCase
description:
Create a use case for restarting agent sessions with environment preservation.

File: src/application/use-cases/session/RestartAgentUseCase.ts

Responsibilities:
- Restart agent CLI without losing environment
- Leverage tmux environment persistence (no re-injection needed if tmux session preserved)
- If tmux session recreated, re-inject environment via EnvironmentManager
- Update agent state in repository
- Send new agent command via tmux gateway

Flow:
1. Load session from repository
2. Mark as restarting, save
3. If tmux session exists, just send new command (env persists)
4. If tmux session gone, recreate with environment from EnvironmentManager
5. Mark as running, save

Interface:
export class RestartAgentUseCase {
  constructor(
    sessionRepo: SessionRepository,
    tmuxGateway: TmuxGateway,
    environmentManager: EnvironmentManager
  )
  
  async execute(sessionId: string, userId: string): Promise<Session>;
}

Tests: Mock dependencies, verify state transitions, verify command sent
close_reason: Created RestartAgentUseCase with 12 tests, handles agent restart with environment preservation

title: Phase 2: Claude Code Configuration Editor
description:
Full configuration editor for Claude Code CLI.

Configuration sections:
- Core settings (model, cleanupPeriodDays, env)
- Attribution settings (commit, pr, includeCoAuthoredBy)
- Permission settings (allow, ask, deny, defaultMode)
- Sandbox settings (enabled, network options)
- Hook configuration (PreToolUse, PostToolUse)
- Status line configuration
- MCP servers management
- Output settings (verbose, notifications, colors)
close_reason: All Phase 2 Claude Code configuration editor tasks completed

title: Electron Desktop App - Phase 2: Platform Abstraction
description:
Create platform abstraction layer:
- Platform-aware exec wrapper (electron/platform/platform-exec.ts)
- WSL detection and management (electron/platform/wsl-service.ts)
- macOS adapter with Homebrew (electron/platform/adapters/macos.ts)
- Linux adapter with apt/dnf/pacman (electron/platform/adapters/linux.ts)
- Windows/WSL adapter (electron/platform/adapters/windows.ts)
- Path translation utilities (Windows <-> WSL)
- Database schema updates for WSL settings
close_reason: Completed platform abstraction layer with WSL detection, path translation, adapters for macOS/Linux/Windows, and platform-aware execution
